required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Imgatuzumab in Patients With Advanced Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Study of Imgatuzumab in Patients With Advanced Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma (I-PACE)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the anti-tumor activity, safety, tolerability, immunogenicity, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics of imgatuzumab, a monoclonal antibody against epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) with enhanced antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC) in patients with advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (CSCC). Quality of life of patients treated with imgatuzumab will also be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) assessed by the Independent Central Review Committee (ICRC) according to the Study Response Criteria
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) assessed by the ICRC according to the Study Response Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR) assessed by the ICRC according to the Study Response Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR, PR or Stable Disease (SD) assessed by the ICRC according to the Study Response Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR assessed by the investigator according to the Study Response Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR or PR assessed by the investigator according to the Study Response Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: DCR assessed by the investigator according to the Study Response Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR, PR or SD assessed by the investigator according to the Study Response Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS) assessed by the ICRC
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of start of treatment to date of the first progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DoR) assessed by the ICRC
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of response (CR or PR) to date of the first progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Stable Disease (DoSD) assessed by the ICRC
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of SD to date of the first progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS assessed by the investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of start of treatment to date of the first progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: DoR assessed by the investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of response (CR or PR) to date of the first progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: DoSD assessed by the investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of SD to date of the first progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR assessed by the ICRC according to the immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (iRECIST)
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR or PR assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR or PR assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST

secondary_outcome.measure: DCR assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR, PR or SD assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST

secondary_outcome.measure: DCR assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving CR, PR or SD assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of start of treatment to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of start of treatment to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: DoR assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of response (CR or PR) to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: DoR assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of response (CR or PR) to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: DoSD assessed by the ICRC according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of SD to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the ICRC

secondary_outcome.measure: DoSD assessed by the investigator according to the iRECIST
secondary_outcome.description: Time from date of first assessment of SD to date of the first iRECIST progression documented by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability profile assessed by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v5.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and duration of dose interruptions and reductions
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability profile assessed by frequency and duration of dose interruptions and reductions

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of imgatuzumab-reactive antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity profile characterized by concentrations of imgatuzumab-reactive antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed concentration (C[max])
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic profile characterized by the maximum observed concentration (C[max]) of imgatuzumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic profile characterized by the area under the curve (AUC) of imgatuzumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal half-life (t[1/2])
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic profile characterized by the terminal half-life (t[1/2]) of imgatuzumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic profile characterized by the time to maximum concentration (Tmax) of imgatuzumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of patient-reported outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life assessed by change in scores of patient-reported outcomes in European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)

intervention.description: Imgatuzumab administered as an intravenous infusion on Day 1 and Day 8 of the first 21-day cycle, and on Day 1 of each subsequent 14-day cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed diagnosis of CSCC
- CSCC of advanced stage
- Males or females at least 18 years of age at the time of consent
- Signed informed consent provided prior to any study procedures
- Ability to and willing to understand informed consent and comply with protocol requirements and procedures
- No more than two prior lines of systemic treatment for advanced disease
- Patients must have at least one lesion that is considered as measurable according to the Study Response Criteria
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0 or 1
- Adequate function of bone marrow, liver, kidneys
- Availability of tumor tissue sample (either an archival specimen or a fresh biopsy material) at Screening
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior systemic treatment for advanced disease with any anti-EGFR agent
- Active central nervous system metastasis
- Systemic anti-cancer therapy within five half-lives or two weeks, whichever is shorter, prior to first dose of the study drug
- Persistent toxicities from previous systemic anti-neoplastic treatments
- Wide-field radiotherapy within four weeks, or focal radiation for analgesic purpose or for lytic lesions at risk of fracture within two weeks prior to first dose of the study drug, or no recovery from side effects of such intervention
- Major surgery within four weeks prior to first dose of the study drug, or no recovery from side effects of such intervention
- Active infection requiring therapy
- Concomitant use of systemic steroids at dose of >10 mg of prednisone or its equivalent per day
- Known or suspected allergy/hypersensitivity to the study drug or any component of the study drug, other monoclonal antibodies, premedication medicines
- Concurrent participation in another investigational therapeutic clinical trial
- Pregnant or breast-feeding females
- Mental or medical conditions that prevent the patient from giving informed consent or participating in the trial
- Other severe acute or chronic medical or psychiatric conditions or laboratory abnormality that may increase the risk associated with the study participation or the study drug administration or may interfere with the interpretation of study results and, in the judgment of the Investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for enrollment in this study
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria apply.
